org.alljoyn.ioe.controlpanelservice

Interface DeviceRegistry

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultDeviceRegistry

    public interface DeviceRegistry
    Used as a callback interface to inform the interface implementer about new discovered devices and changes in their reachability state

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void foundNewDevice(ControllableDevice device)
      Called when a new controllable device was found in the control panel service proximity
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,ControllableDevice> getDevices() 
      void reachabilityChanged(ControllableDevice device, boolean isReachable)
      Called when a controllable device left the control panel service proximity
      The method implementation should be thread safe
      void removeDevice(ControllableDevice device)
      Remove a device from registry
      When a device is removed from the registry it will be inserted back after foundDevice method is called

    • Method Detail

      • foundNewDevice

        void foundNewDevice(ControllableDevice device)
        Called when a new controllable device was found in the control panel service proximity
        Parameters:
        device -

      • reachabilityChanged

        void reachabilityChanged(ControllableDevice device,
                       boolean isReachable)
        Called when a controllable device left the control panel service proximity
        The method implementation should be thread safe
        Parameters:
        device - The controllable device
        isReachable - Whether the device is in reachable state

      • removeDevice

        void removeDevice(ControllableDevice device)
        Remove a device from registry
        When a device is removed from the registry it will be inserted back after foundDevice method is called
        Parameters:
        device -

      • getDevices

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,ControllableDevice> getDevices()
        Returns:
        Returns collection of controllable devices
